meanings.definition: A device consisting of a screw with a head that can be turned by the thumb and two pointed ends, used for fastening objects together or for applying pressure.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic used a thumbscrew to secure the metal pieces tightly.
meanings.sent2: She tightened the thumbscrew to keep the wooden planks in place.
meanings.sent3: In a playful manner, he pretended the thumbscrew was a tiny wizard's wand.
meanings.sent4: The thumbscrew of deadlines pushed everyone to work faster.
meanings.sent5: The shiny thumbscrew gleamed under the bright light of the workshop.

meanings.definition: To put pressure on or coerce someone into doing something.
meanings.sent1: The bully tried to thumbscrew his classmates into giving him their lunch money.
meanings.sent2: She didn't want to thumbscrew her friends into agreeing with her opinion.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly threatened to thumbscrew his brother into cleaning his room.
meanings.sent4: The strict teacher would never thumbscrew her students into cheating on the test.
meanings.sent5: The politician's speech was designed to thumbscrew the audience into supporting his campaign.
